Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Just now, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> My brother is going to Philmont in August. Also I heard last year someone died from the flooding.
> 

Yeah, they put their tent in the wrong place, and when they were asleep, a flash flood happened, and dragged the tent down. They found the body the next morning.![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Spaceception said:
> 
> 
> Yeah, they put their tent in the wrong place, and when they were asleep, a flash flood happened, and dragged the tent down. They found the body the next morning.![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
> 

Ah, terrible. I heard someone say at NYLT it was a 40 foot wall of water, they weren't sure if he died on impact or drowned.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> My brother is going to Philmont in August. Also I heard last year someone died from the flooding.
> 

Yes, that's true. I was in Colorado Springs when it happened, and we were within a few hundred meters of the site on our own trek the following week. Needless to say, we were all very careful when we selected our campsites.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, Spaceception said:
> 
> 
> Yeah, they put their tent in the wrong place, and when they were asleep, a flash flood happened, and dragged the tent down. They found the body the next morning.![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
> 

Yep, something like that.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Ah, terrible. I heard someone say at NYLT it was a 40 foot wall of water, they weren't sure if he died on impact or drowned.
> 

Yes, it was a flash flood. I didn't get to experience any, thank god, but I've been told that they sound like a locomotive.
Passed my eagle board of review!!!

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, insert\_name said:
> 
> 
> Passed my eagle board of review!!!
> 

Congratulations! I know the feeling of sweet relief when you hear the news that you passed. I almost couldn't breathe for ten minutes cause I was so excited and relived. Congats man. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, insert\_name said:
> 
> 
> Passed my eagle board of review!!!
> 

Way to go!

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Endersmens said:
> 
> 
> Congratulations! I know the feeling of sweet relief when you hear the news that you passed. I almost couldn't breathe for ten minutes cause I was so excited and relived. Congats man. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Me too. I remember that my cheeks hurt for a good half hour afterwards, because I was smiling too much.

> 
> 
> On 7/20/2016 at 10:10 PM, insert\_name said:
> 
> 
> Passed my eagle board of review!!!
> 

I know exactly how you were feeling because I also just passed my board of review.
I'm basically at Second Class now, about to get to my BOR.
So I'm just a Scoutmaster... does that count? Lulz...

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Deskoski said:
> 
> 
> So I'm just a Scoutmaster... does that count? Lulz...
> 

Yes. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I am an Eagle Scout and work part time as a membership executive for my local council.  I also direct the STEM program during summer camp.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-12-09T03:35:56Z" title="12/09/2016 03:35  AM" data-short="7 yr">December 9, 2016</time> by EvermoreAlpaca**
Forgot about this thread for a bit, but I ranked up to Life Scout last Tuesday.

> 
> 
> 56 minutes ago, EvermoreAlpaca said:
> 
> 
> I am an Eagle Scout and work part time as a membership executive for my local council.  I also direct the STEM program during summer camp.
> 

Way to go!

> Forgot about this thread for a bit, but I ranked up to Life Scout last Tuesday.
> 

Congratulations! Any idea what your Eagle Project will be?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-12-09T04:33:00Z" title="12/09/2016 04:33  AM" data-short="7 yr">December 9, 2016</time> by Dman979**

> 
> 
> Just now, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Congratulations! Any idea what you're Eagle Project will be?
> 

Nope. I gotta think, but I have a good 4 years or so until I age out, so I have time to think.

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Nope. I gotta think, but I have a good 4 years or so until I age out, so I have time to think.
> 

Believe me, it goes by really quickly, and they take longer than you'd think. Start now!

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Believe me, it goes by really quickly, and they take longer than you'd think. Start now!
> 

Yeah, I've been trying to think of ideas.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Yeah, I've been trying to think of ideas.
> 

Find something you like. Do that.

I like history, so I did an oral history project. Be creative, and when you find something you like, don't take "no" for an answer. It's *your* project, not your mom's, Scoutmaster's, or SPL's.

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Forgot about this thread for a bit, but I ranked up to Life Scout last Tuesday.
> 

Congrats!

Wow... my name is not on the thread. I'm an Eagle Scout (1987) with three silver palms (45 merit badges above Eagle). Explorer Achievement Award (1988), OA (Brotherhood), with Scouter's Key, Commissioner's Key, and Silver Beaver.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-12-09T16:18:47Z" title="12/09/2016 04:18  PM" data-short="7 yr">December 9, 2016</time> by adsii1970**

-JWOC
